connector.description: Send requests to external HTTP servers using Vert.x

camel.sink.path.httpUri.name: camel.sink.path.httpUri
camel.sink.path.httpUri.description: The HTTP URI to connect to

camel.sink.endpoint.connectTimeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectTimeout
camel.sink.endpoint.connectTimeout.description: The amount of time in milliseconds until a connection is established. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.

camel.sink.endpoint.cookieStore.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cookieStore
camel.sink.endpoint.cookieStore.description: A custom CookieStore to use when session management is enabled. If this option is not set then an in-memory CookieStore is used

camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.description: A custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.sink.endpoint.httpMethod.name: camel.sink.endpoint.httpMethod
camel.sink.endpoint.httpMethod.description: The HTTP method to use. The HttpMethod header cannot override this option if set

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.okStatusCodeRange.name: camel.sink.endpoint.okStatusCodeRange
camel.sink.endpoint.okStatusCodeRange.description: The status codes which are considered a success response. The values are inclusive. Multiple ranges can be defined, separated by comma, e.g. 200-204,209,301-304. Each range must be a single number or from-to with the dash included

camel.sink.endpoint.responsePayloadAsByt.name: camel.sink.endpoint.responsePayloadAsByteArray
camel.sink.endpoint.responsePayloadAsByt.description: Whether the response body should be byte or as io.vertx.core.buffer.Buffer

camel.sink.endpoint.sessionManagement.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sessionManagement
camel.sink.endpoint.sessionManagement.description: Enables session management via WebClientSession. By default the client is configured to use an in-memory CookieStore. The cookieStore option can be used to override this

camel.sink.endpoint.throwExceptionOnFail.name: camel.sink.endpoint.throwExceptionOnFailure
camel.sink.endpoint.throwExceptionOnFail.description: Disable throwing HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server

camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeout
camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.description: The amount of time in milliseconds after which if the request does not return any data within the timeout period a TimeoutException fails the request. Setting zero or a negative value disables the timeout.

camel.sink.endpoint.transferException.name: camel.sink.endpoint.transferException
camel.sink.endpoint.transferException.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side, and if the caused Exception was sent back serialized in the response as a application/x-java-serialized-object content type. On the producer side the exception will be deserialized and thrown as is, instead of HttpOperationFailedException. The caused exception is required to be serialized. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Camel will deserialize the incoming data from the request to a Java object, which can be a potential security risk.

camel.sink.endpoint.useCompression.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useCompression
camel.sink.endpoint.useCompression.description: Set whether compression is enabled to handled compressed (E.g gzipped) responses

camel.sink.endpoint.vertxHttpBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.vertxHttpBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.vertxHttpBinding.description: A custom VertxHttpBinding which can control how to bind between Vert.x and Camel.

camel.sink.endpoint.webClientOptions.name: camel.sink.endpoint.webClientOptions
camel.sink.endpoint.webClientOptions.description: Sets customized options for configuring the Vert.x WebClient

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPassword.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPassword
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPassword.description: The proxy server password if authentication is required

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyType
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyType.description: The proxy server type One of: [HTTP] [SOCKS4] [SOCKS5]

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyUsername.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyUsername
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyUsername.description: The proxy server username if authentication is required

camel.sink.endpoint.basicAuthPassword.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicAuthPassword
camel.sink.endpoint.basicAuthPassword.description: The password to use for basic authentication

camel.sink.endpoint.basicAuthUsername.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicAuthUsername
camel.sink.endpoint.basicAuthUsername.description: The user name to use for basic authentication

camel.sink.endpoint.bearerToken.name: camel.sink.endpoint.bearerToken
camel.sink.endpoint.bearerToken.description: The bearer token to use for bearer token authentication

camel.component.vertx-http.lazyStartProd.name: camel.component.vertx-http.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.vertx-http.lazyStartProd.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.vertx-http.responsePaylo.name: camel.component.vertx-http.responsePayloadAsByteArray
camel.component.vertx-http.responsePaylo.description: Whether the response body should be byte or as io.vertx.core.buffer.Buffer

camel.component.vertx-http.allowJavaSeri.name: camel.component.vertx-http.allowJavaSerializedObject
camel.component.vertx-http.allowJavaSeri.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request has the Content-Type application/x-java-serialized-object This is disabled by default. If you enable this, be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request. This can be a potential security risk.

camel.component.vertx-http.autowiredEnab.name: camel.component.vertx-http.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.vertx-http.autowiredEnab.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.vertx-http.vertx.name: camel.component.vertx-http.vertx
camel.component.vertx-http.vertx.description: To use an existing vertx instead of creating a new instance

camel.component.vertx-http.vertxHttpBind.name: camel.component.vertx-http.vertxHttpBinding
camel.component.vertx-http.vertxHttpBind.description: A custom VertxHttpBinding which can control how to bind between Vert.x and Camel

camel.component.vertx-http.vertxOptions.name: camel.component.vertx-http.vertxOptions
camel.component.vertx-http.vertxOptions.description: To provide a custom set of vertx options for configuring vertx

camel.component.vertx-http.headerFilterS.name: camel.component.vertx-http.headerFilterStrategy
camel.component.vertx-http.headerFilterS.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.component.vertx-http.proxyPassword.name: camel.component.vertx-http.proxyPassword
camel.component.vertx-http.proxyPassword.description: The proxy server password if authentication is required

camel.component.vertx-http.proxyType.name: camel.component.vertx-http.proxyType
camel.component.vertx-http.proxyType.description: The proxy server type One of: [HTTP] [SOCKS4] [SOCKS5]

camel.component.vertx-http.proxyUsername.name: camel.component.vertx-http.proxyUsername
camel.component.vertx-http.proxyUsername.description: The proxy server username if authentication is required

camel.component.vertx-http.basicAuthPass.name: camel.component.vertx-http.basicAuthPassword
camel.component.vertx-http.basicAuthPass.description: The password to use for basic authentication

camel.component.vertx-http.basicAuthUser.name: camel.component.vertx-http.basicAuthUsername
camel.component.vertx-http.basicAuthUser.description: The user name to use for basic authentication

camel.component.vertx-http.bearerToken.name: camel.component.vertx-http.bearerToken
camel.component.vertx-http.bearerToken.description: The bearer token to use for bearer token authentication

camel.component.vertx-http.useGlobalSslC.name: camel.component.vertx-http.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.vertx-http.useGlobalSslC.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters
